1.action: IMPORTANT NOTE: The firsts 5 steps refer to configuration of the environment to run the rest of the steps. These only apply for CROPS-eSDK.

2.action: Initiate your Crops-esdk environment as it says in wiki https://github.com/crops/docker-win-mac-docs/wiki

3.action: Create the following tree of files  <crops-esdk-workdir-workspace>/sdkext/files/myapp <crops-esdk-workdir-workspace>/sdkext/files/myapp_cmake

4.action:
Create the following files withing the myapp directory  myapp.c and the Makefile. Write the following inside of each file: 
---------------------------------------- 
Makefile should contain  

all: myapp  

myapp: myapp.o 
	$(CC) $(LDFLAGS) $< -o $@  

myapp.o: myapp.c  
	$(CC) $(CFLAGS) -c $< -o $@ 

clean: 
	rm -rf myapp.o myapp  

-----------------------------  
myapp.c  shold contain  


#include <stdio.h>    

int 
main(int argc, char *argv[]) 
{ 
	printf("Hello world\n"); 
 
	return 0; 
} 
------------------------------------
4.expected_results: be sure that the indentations on the makefile are tabs not spaces.

5.action:
Create the following files within the myapp_cmake directory CMakeLists.txt and myapp.c. Write the following inside each file:  

------------------------------------ 
CMakeLists.txt should contain:  

cmake_minimum_required (VERSION 2.6) 
project (myapp) 
# The version number. 
set (myapp_VERSION_MAJOR 1) 
set (myapp_VERSION_MINOR 0)  

# add the executable 
add_executable (myapp myapp.c)  

install(TARGETS myapp 
RUNTIME DESTINATION bin)  

------------------------------------------ 
myapp.c should contain:  

#include <stdio.h>     

int  
main(int argc, char *argv[])  
{ 
	printf("Hello world\n");  

	return 0; 
} 
-------------------------------------------------
5.expected_results: Be sure that the indentations on CMakeLists.txt is tabs not spaces.

6.expected_results: This should output a message that says SDK environment now set up; additionally you may now run devtool to perform development tasks etc etc ...

7.expected_results: this should output the directory of the devtool script and it should be within the sdk workdir you are working in.

8.action: devtool add myapp <directory>(this is myapp dir)
8.expected_results: The directory you should input is the myapp directory. This should automatically create the recipe myapp.bb under <crops-esdk-workdir-workspace>/recipes/myapp/myapp.bb

10.expected_results: This cleans sysroot of the myapp recipe, but it leaves the source tree intact. meaning it does not erase.

5.action:
Create the following files within the myapp_cmake directory CMakeLists.txt and myapp.c. Write the following inside each file:

CMakeLists.txt should contain:  

cmake_minimum_required (VERSION 2.6) 
project (myapp)

9.expected_results: you should expect a package creation of myapp and it should be under the  /tmp/deploy/

10.expected_results:
This cleans sysroot of the myapp recipe, but it leaves the source tree intact. meaning it does not erase.
</package_format>

1.action: IMPORTANT NOTE: The firsts 2 steps refer to configuration of the environment to run the rest of the steps. These only apply for CROPS-eSDK.

2.action: Initiate your Crops-esdk environment as it says in wiki https://github.com/crops/docker-win-mac-docs/wiki

3.expected_results: This should output a message that says SDK environment now set up; additionally you may now run devtool to perform development tasks etc etc ...

4.expected_results: this should output the directory of the devtool script and it should be within the sdk workdir you are working in.

6.expected_results: This should automatically create the recipe librdfa.bb under /recipes/librdfa/librdfa.bb

8.expected_results: This cleans sysroot of the librdfa recipe, but it leaves the source tree intact. meaning it does not erase.

1.action:
IMPORTANT NOTE: The firsts 2 steps refer to configuration of the environment to run the rest of the steps. These only apply for CROPS-eSDK.    


lets say variable npm = npm://registry.npmjs.org;name=winston;version=2.2.0

2.action: Initiate your Crops-esdk environment as it says in wiki https://github.com/crops/docker-win-mac-docs/wiki

3.expected_results: This should output a message that says SDK environment now set up; additionally you may now run devtool to perform development tasks etc etc ...

4.expected_results: this should output the directory of the devtool script and it should be within the sdk workdir you are working in.

5.action:
4a) git clone git://git.openembedded.org/meta-openembedded in  layers/build  directory   
 
4b) Add meta-openembedded/meta-oe in bblayer.conf as mentioned below: ${SDKBASEMETAPATH}/layers/build/meta-openembedded/meta-oe \   

4c) devtool add "npm://registry.npmjs.org;name=npm;version=2.2.0"
5.expected_results: This should automatically create the recipe npm.bb under /recipes/npm/npm.bb

7.expected_results: This cleans sysroot of the npm recipe, but it leaves the source tree intact. meaning it does not erase.
